parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Axle Seal Failure and Grease Contamination of Brakes
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the axle seals can cause grease to leak onto the brake shoes and drums, leading to a significant loss of braking power, which can result in accidents or near-miss situations.
symptoms: Brake shoes and drums are contaminated with grease
brake controller gain has to be set to maximum level
inability to stop the trailer in a safe distance.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Undersized Wiring and Substandard Brake Wiring
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The use of undersized wiring and substandard brake wiring can cause the brakes to malfunction, leading to a loss of braking power, which can result in accidents or near-miss situations.
symptoms: brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake pedal sticks to the floor
brake pedal does not return to its normal position
brake pedal has a delayed return to its normal position.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the leaf spring hanger can cause the axle to shift out of place, leading to loss of control, accidents, or damage to the trailer and its components.
symptoms: The trailer does not track straight
the axle is shifted out of place
the leaf spring hanger is broken
the spring and axle are lodged inside the frame
the exterior sheet metal is warped
and there is a visible gap.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The improper grease used in the wheel bearings can cause leaks past seals, contaminating the brake magnets and brakes, leading to a loss of braking ability and potential accidents.
Poor welding and frame separation can lead to structural integrity issues, causing the trailer to be unsafe to tow and potentially leading to accidents.
symptoms: U-bolts needing to be cut off and replaced.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The use of incorrect wheel bearings can lead to premature wear, excessive residue buildup, and grease seal failure, which can cause brake contamination and potentially lead to accidents or loss of control.
Wheel bearing failure can cause loss of control, accidents, or brake failure, which can result in serious injury or death.
